content: How do I close old alt accounts that I can't access?

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Okay that is my new alt above.I have two inaccessible alt accounts.philipma1957 DT1 --------- my main accountPhilipma1957cellphone DT2 no access   https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2664833Philipma1957onvacation no access https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=537107philipma1957laptop ------- my mobile account used for secure purposes on the road.a1 Hashrate LLC2022 ------- new form alt to comply with federal tax laws in a new manner due to my 65th birthday.What section of the forum do I ask how to shut the old accounts down.TIA

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on June 07, 2022, 07:39:40 PMWhat section of the forum do I ask how to shut the old accounts down.I cannot remember any situation where alt accounts where closed by the admins. If you remember your secret question and the answer, you can try to recover the account using that to lock your profile.Try to log in, click on forgot password and then "Ask me my question". This action should lock your account as it was disabled some time back.P.S; did you merit your alt?

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: this is a very interesting situation, I think it's all up to the moderators.I don't think they should suspend those accounts just because you claim they are your alts. that is not enough proof.If you haven't access to him, you can't confirm that they are in your hands. Probably only if there are any Bitcoin addresses associated with these accounts where you can sign the message. Or even maybe you can ask admins just to give you a hint as to which email addresses were used for registration, maybe you remember and manage to regain access to those accounts.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: This is not something the forum usually does. There are already several topics similar to you and each time people answered "never log in and that's it".In reality, nothing prevents getting an exception if the admin agrees. After all, Lauda requested to theymos to ban his/her account and it has been done. So why yes for Lauda and not for philipma1957? That's up to you to convince the admin, héhé.It's a matter of a few minutes to do it, but if thousands of users request the same thing... that's another problem.

comments.body: Maybe the account recovery team can help with proving those really are your accounts. comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: a1 Hashrate LLC2022 on June 07, 2022, 07:33:25 PMHow do I close old alt accounts that I can't access?There is no delete option available in bitcointalk like we see in facebook and Instagram  Anyway you don't have access then you no need to worry but if the account hacked by someone so you lost your access then create thread in reputation section with the evidence that account belongs to you and how you lost account so it will be tagged and then its almost useless here.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: a1 Hashrate LLC2022 on June 07, 2022, 07:33:25 PMHow do I close old alt accounts that I can't access?There is no option to close accounts in bitcointalk forum.However, Lauda asked theymos to ban his account before he left the forum, so it's possible for admins to do it if you ask them in personal messages (not guaranteed they will do it).Making your old accounts inactive is also fine, and you don't need to do anything, except maybe posting with your main account about your decision.
